title: The Ten Commandments Quiz - Test Your Knowledge of Exodus 20
description: How well do you know the Ten Commandments? Test your knowledge of the foundational commandments given by God to Moses at Mount Sinai in Exodus 20.

questions.question: What is the first commandment as stated in Exodus 20:2?
options: Know there is a G-d
Do not make an idol for yourself
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy
Honor your father and your mother
questions.explanation: The first commandment (#1) states 'I am the LORD your God...' emphasizing the knowledge of G-d as foundational.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids having other gods before the LORD?
options: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Do not murder
questions.correctAnswer: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #2 explicitly prohibits other gods before the LORD (Exodus 20:3).

questions.question: According to the commandments, what is forbidden regarding idols?
options: Do not make an idol for yourself
Make idols only for decorative purposes
Worship idols as you worship G-d
Build altars with metal-hewn stones
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make an idol for yourself
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 prohibits making any idol likeness (Exodus 20:4).

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to remember and keep the Sabbath holy?
options: Sanctify the Sabbath (in speech) from beginning to end
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Do not steal
Honor your father and your mother
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctify the Sabbath (in speech) from beginning to end
questions.explanation: Commandment #91 commands remembering the sabbath day to keep it holy (Exodus 20:8).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids taking the name of the LORD your God in vain?
options: Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Do not bear false witness against your neighbor
Do not covet your neighbor's house
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Do not take G-d's Name in vain
questions.explanation: Commandment #210 forbids taking G-d's name in vain with the warning of punishment (Exodus 20:7).

questions.question: What is the prohibition related to the Sabbath day as per Exodus 20:10?
options: Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship G-d
Do not make other gods besides Me
Do not testify falsely
questions.correctAnswer: Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
questions.explanation: Commandment #88 forbids any work on the Sabbath (Exodus 20:10).

questions.question: Which commandment speaks about honoring parents?
options: Respect your father or mother
Do not murder
Do not steal
Do not covet your neighbor's wife
questions.explanation: Commandment #584 commands honoring parents for a prolonged life (Exodus 20:12).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids murder?
options: Do not murder
Do not covet and scheme to acquire another's possession
Do not make an idol for yourself
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
questions.explanation: Commandment #482 forbids murder explicitly (Exodus 20:13).

questions.question: What does the commandment about false testimony prohibit?
options: Do not testify falsely
Do not steal
Do not murder
Do not do prohibited labor on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Commandment #576 forbids bearing false witness against a neighbor (Exodus 20:16).

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits coveting your neighbor's possessions?
options: Do not covet and scheme to acquire another's possession
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
questions.correctAnswer: Do not covet and scheme to acquire another's possession
questions.explanation: Commandment #476 forbids coveting neighbor’s house, wife, servants, or livestock (Exodus 20:17).

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a commandment about God but about people?
options: Honor your father and your mother
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship G-d
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy
questions.correctAnswer: Honor your father and your mother
questions.explanation: Commandment #584 relates to people and family, unlike commandments #210, #91 which relate to G-d.

questions.question: Where did Moses receive the Ten Commandments according to biblical context?
options: Mount Sinai
Mount Ararat
Mount Zion
Mount Carmel
questions.explanation: The Ten Commandments were given to Moses on Mount Sinai as the foundational laws for Israel.

questions.question: Which commandment specifically warns that the LORD is a jealous God?
options: Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not steal
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Honor your father and your mother
questions.correctAnswer: Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
questions.explanation: Commandments #27 and #28 mention the LORD as a jealous God warning against idol worship (Exodus 20:5).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids building an altar with stones hewn by metal?
options: Do not build the altar with stones hewn by metal
Do not climb steps to the altar
Do not make an idol for yourself
Do not murder
questions.correctAnswer: Do not build the altar with stones hewn by metal
questions.explanation: Commandment #302 forbids using metal-cut stones for altars to avoid profaning them (Exodus 20:25).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids climbing steps to the altar?
options: Do not climb steps to the altar
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
Do not covet your neighbor's wife
questions.correctAnswer: Do not climb steps to the altar
questions.explanation: Commandment #303 forbids climbing steps to avoid exposing nakedness at the altar (Exodus 20:26).

questions.question: Which commandment is categorized under Courts, Crimes, and Punishments?
options: Do not kidnap
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship G-d
Honor your father and your mother
questions.explanation: Commandment #473, 'Do not steal,' falls under Courts, Crimes, and Punishments (Exodus 20:15).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'You shall have no other gods before Me' is about worshiping idols.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: This commandment (#2) forbids having other gods before the LORD, not necessarily idols themselves (Exodus 20:3).

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 20:12, honoring your parents may prolong your days in the land God gives you.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #584 promises longevity for honoring father and mother (Exodus 20:12).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy' requires only physical rest.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #91 involves sanctifying the Sabbath in speech and rest, not just physical rest (Exodus 20:8).

questions.question: True or False: The Ten Commandments are found in Exodus chapter 20.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: All commandments in this quiz cite Exodus 20 as their source chapter.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment against coveting only refers to a neighbor's wife.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #476 forbids coveting neighbor’s house, wife, servants, ox, and donkey (Exodus 20:17).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'You shall not make for yourself an ______, or any likeness of what is in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the water under the earth.'
options: idol
altar
prayer
oath
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 forbids making idols of any likeness (Exodus 20:4).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Remember the ______ day, to keep it holy.'
options: sabbath
first
last
festival
questions.explanation: Commandment #91 instructs to remember the sabbath day for holiness (Exodus 20:8).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids making human forms even for decorative purposes?
options: Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not bear false witness against your neighbor
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not take G-d's Name in vain
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
questions.explanation: Commandment #31 forbids making other gods or human forms, even for decoration (Exodus 20:23).

questions.question: What is the category of the commandment 'Do not steal'?
options: Courts, Crimes, and Punishments
Appointed Times
Marriage and Family
Temple and Sacred Objects
questions.explanation: Commandment #473 against stealing is categorized under Courts, Crimes, and Punishments (Exodus 20:15).
